decks.notes: This deck focuses on generating as much mana as possible through cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, then using that mana to cast multiple spells in a turn, eventually leading to a big storm count and finishing off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot. It also utilizes the card selection provided by Reckless Impulse and the card draw from Ral, Monsoon Mage to ensure consistency in the combo. The deck aims to be fast and explosive, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to react.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana with Birthing Ritual to cast powerful Simic creatures like Shardless Agent, Ice-Fang Coatl, and Endurance. It also utilizes cards like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation to control the board and protect its creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and disruption, while also utilizing cards like Coiling Oracle and Subtlety for card advantage and flexibility. Additionally, the inclusion of Fblthp, the Lost and Abhorrent Oculus adds some unique synergies to the deck.

This deck revolves around utilizing Allosaurus Rider and Eldritch Evolution to quickly summon powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Xenagos, God of Revels. It also includes a variety of support cards such as Pact of Negation and Misty Rainforest to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The inclusion of Veil of Summer and Endurance helps to protect the combo from disruption, while cards like Consign to Memory and Planar Genesis provide additional value and control options. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana and storm count, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn and eventually win the game through a massive Grapeshot or Ral, Monsoon Mage activation. The key strategy is to use rituals and mana-producing spells like Manamorphose and Ruby Medallion to build up resources, while also utilizing cards like Reckless Impulse and Wish to dig for combo pieces. The deck aims to be explosive and overwhelming, finishing off the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to quickly combo off and summon powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand onto the battlefield. Consign to Memory and Pact of Negation are included to protect the combo, while Veil of Summer helps to keep the combo safe from disruption. The deck also includes cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Ureni, the Song Unending to provide additional support and advantage. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game quickly.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, you can put pressure on your opponent from the start. With cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ranger-Captain of Eos providing additional support and card advantage, this deck aims to win the game quickly before your opponent can set up their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells in order to deal damage quickly and decisively. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. Additionally, cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provide support and additional ways to increase the pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to maintain a fast-paced tempo and keep the opponent on the back foot throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize a combination of cards that do not require lands in order to set up a powerful combo that can potentially win the game in a single turn. By using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom, along with counterspells like Force of Negation and Waterlogged Teachings, the deck aims to disrupt and control the opponent while setting up its own win condition. The synergy between the cards in the deck allows for a unique and strategic approach to winning games in the Modern format.

The deck revolves around generating mana quickly and efficiently to cast spells that allow the player to draw cards and find combo pieces, ultimately culminating in a storm of spells that overwhelm the opponent. The use of Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage help reduce the cost of spells, while Past in Flames allows for spells to be recast from the graveyard. The deck also includes Wish cards for added versatility and options. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful storm of spells to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board through the use of direct damage spells and quick, evasive creatures. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Slickshot Show-Off alongside spells like Lava Dart, Lightning Bolt, and Violent Urge, the deck aims to apply early pressure and finish off opponents swiftly. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to maintain consistency and adapt to different board states.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to efficiently use low-cost creatures like Ragavan and Ocelot Pride to deal damage early on, while also utilizing cards like Phlage and Goblin Bombardment for additional reach and removal. The inclusion of cards like Ajani and Ranger-Captain provide additional versatility and disruption, while cards like Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to maintain pressure throughout the game and capitalize on opportunities for quick victories.

This UW Control deck focuses on control and disruption, using cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to limit opponent's options. It also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Orim's Chant and Spell Snare to protect its own game plan. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter allows for the repeated use of powerful instant spells. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game through disruption and removal while setting up its own win conditions.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay while also disrupting the opponent with taxing effects and removal spells. It aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures like Solitude and Overlord of the Balemurk, while also using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also features cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to provide additional value and versatility. By combining fast aggression with disruptive elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing mill cards and creatures to quickly deplete the opponent's library, while also disrupting their game plan with targeted removal. It aims to control the board with creatures like Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab, while also utilizing spells like Archive Trap and Fractured Sanity to mill large amounts of cards at once. Cards like Surgical Extraction and Crypt Incursion provide graveyard hate and lifegain, while Tasha's Hideous Laughter can exile a large portion of the opponent's library. The deck also includes some counter magic and removal spells to control the opponent's threats.

The focus of this deck is to ramp up quickly using Eldrazi Temple and various mana accelerators, allowing you to cast big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker ahead of schedule. Control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command help you disrupt your opponent's strategy while also supporting your own game plan. The inclusion of cards like Ugin's Labyrinth and Sire of Seven Deaths provides additional ways to control the battlefield and protect your powerful creatures. Overall, this deck aims to dominate the game through a combination of ramp, control, and big Eldrazi threats.

The deck focuses on using the Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to search for and play powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. By utilizing land ramp and land synergy, the deck aims to quickly assemble its win condition and overwhelm opponents before they can react. The deck is designed to be fast and proactive, using its unique combination of cards to create powerful combos that can lead to swift victories.
